summary: Investigated task creation save button issue in new project context
Examined UI component for save/submit functionality
Identified potential problem with task persistence or project initialization

suggestedTasks.title: Debug Task Creation Persistence in New Project Context
suggestedTasks.description: Investigate why tasks are not saving when creating in a new project. Specifically examine the task creation workflow, database insertion logic, and project initialization process. Check for any validation, permission, or state management issues that might prevent task persistence. Review server-side logs and client-side state management.
suggestedTasks.reason: Task creation failure prevents user workflow

suggestedTasks.title: Add Logging for Task Creation Events
suggestedTasks.description: Implement comprehensive logging for task creation process to capture all steps and potential failure points. Add client and server-side logging to track task creation attempts, validation steps, and database insertion attempts. This will help diagnose future issues and provide better debugging information.
suggestedTasks.reason: User reported lack of visibility into task creation process

summary: Fixed double-submit bug in TaskCreationDrawer save button
Changed button type from submit to button to prevent two handleSubmit calls racing
Discovered user personal project was manually added to config without bd init
Initialized git and beads for personal project

patterns: When using onclick handlers on form buttons, use type=button not type=submit to avoid double-submit
gotchas: Projects added manually to ~/.config/jat/projects.json without bd init will fail task creation
